Senecio madagascariensis Poir. (Asteraceae) is a species native to South Africa and Madagascar that is currently considered invasive in Australia
15 , south-east Asia
16 , South America
17, 18 and North America
19 . In South America, this species was recorded for the first time in Argentina, where it was found in the port area in Bahía Blanca (Buenos Aires province) in the 1940s
17 . In about 30 years, S. madagascarienis successfully invaded the north of Buenos Aires province and nearby provinces. Currently, this species is widely distributed in northern and central Argentina, and southeastern Brazil
20 .
